content.description: Awesome commuting tall face with a lot of pumpy moves down low and small crimps/crystals up top. Test your pump and your mind on this one. Start low and right crouching on obvious good crack flake features follow the feature left till its end. Follow the shallow seam and crystals to the top. The fall isn't the best so commit and top it out. Long with many moves. Kind of a big move to transition into the upper face.

SDS matched on the sculpted jug at the base of the boulder. Climb straight up with powerful moves on relatively good holds. Pull the hardest move(s) to gain the lip followed by a textbook mantle. Only a few moves long but they each pack a punch. Almost as pure and classy as it gets. Definitely a boulderer's boulder.
content.protection: Crash Pads spotter would be good.
content.location: Far side of the trail side (east) face. Starting hold is a jug just above the mini-roof at the boulder's base.

content.description: Obvious overhang problem to the left of king of town. This is in the "cave" feature. It follows up the very steep overhang and exits through the right side key hole. Looks impossible put actually flows good with the right holds. Another pumpy LONG problems.

The Boulder on the backside of the Sylvan lake damn offers the some if not the hardest problems in the Hills. Chuck Fryberger first climbed homestar (v11) and King Of Town (v13/v14) was first done by Matt Tschol today it remains unrepeated.
